history.proof: intros. unfold red in H. unfold spolyp in H. unfold spolyp. destruct a, b. simpl in H. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type A0, A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA, multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) x : list (Term A n) c : canonical A0 eqA ltM x x0 : list (Term A n) c0 : canonical A0 eqA ltM x0 aL : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) H : reducestar A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec aL (spolyf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec x0 x c0 c) (pO A n) Unable to unify "reducestar A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec aL (spolyf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec x0 x c0 c) (pO A n)" with "red (exist (fun a : list (Term A n) => canonical A0 eqA ltM a) (spolyf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec x x0 c c0) (spolyf_canonical A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA cs eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec os x x0 c c0)) aL".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (a b : poly A0 eqA ltM) (aL : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)), red (spolyp a b) aL -> red (spolyp b a) aL

Premises:
spolyp = fun p q : poly A0 eqA ltM => let (x, x0) := p in (let (x, Cpx) := q in fun (x0 : list (Term A n)) (Cpx0 : canonical A0 eqA ltM x0) => exist (fun a : list (Term A n) => canonical A0 eqA ltM a) (spolyf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec x x0 Cpx Cpx0) (spolyf_canonical A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA cs eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec os x x0 Cpx Cpx0)) x x0 : poly A0 eqA ltM -> poly A0 eqA ltM -> poly A0 eqA ltM
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
mult_mon : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> mon d
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
OrderStructure : forall A : Type, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> (A -> A -> A) -> Prop
zero_mon : forall d : nat, mon d
red = fun (a : poly A0 eqA ltM) (P : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) => reducestar A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec P (s2p A A0 eqA n ltM a) (pO A n) : poly A0 eqA ltM -> list (poly A0 eqA ltM) -> Prop Arguments red _ _%list_scope
